stories.text: Just curious if anyone has seen a change in the trolling, memes, etc on the internet/twitter etc since the Russian actions in Ukraine? Are we seeing a drop in areas of US/Western politics as those resources are directed towards a different offensive front?
stories.title: Ask HN: Has there been a change in the troll activity on the internet?

From engineering to product management, and back again

stories.text:
Last days there are DDoS attacks against many Russian resources (news, banking, government). The interesting point is that the attacks (at least some of them, e.g. against rbc.ru) are running by live people from more than 100K communities using Tor browsers and java script code. There are also plenty of dummy curl scripts. These are essentially full-browser stack L7 DDoS attacks.

Typically, the attacks aren't applicable against business resources since they require large people communities.
stories.title: Full browser stack L7 DDoS against Russian resources
How the Pledge of Allegiance Went from Marketing Ploy to Classroom Staple
